text: Dorothy Jennifer Beatrice Tyler (n√©e Odam; 14 March 1920 - 25 September 2014) was a British athlete. She competed mainly in the high jump. She won two silver medals at the Summer Olympic Games. One at the 1936 Summer Olympics held in Berlin, Germany, and the other at the 1948 Summer Olympics held in London. She was the first British woman to win an Olympic athletics medal herself. She later went on to win a gold medal at two British Empire Games; one in Sydney, New South Wales, Australia (1938), and the other in Auckland, New Zealand (1950). In 2012, she was a starting runner at the London Marathon. Tyler-Odam was born in Stockwell, London. In 2009, at the age of 89, she was made a Member of the Order of the British Empire (MBE). Tyler-Odam died after a long illness on 25 September 2014, aged 94. ==References== ==Other websites== * Dorothy Tyler-Odam at Sports-Reference Category:1920 births Category:2014 deaths Category:British athletes Category:Olympic silver medalists for Great Britain Category:Disease-related deaths in England Category:Members of the Order of the British Empire Category:Sportspeople from London
title: Dorothy Tyler-Odam
